author: __lithp__
content: Made a thread for talking about Kate comitments, if anyone has opinions: https://ethresear.ch/t/should-eth-1-x-commit-to-contract-code-using-kate-commitments/8143

author: __lithp__
content: <@!273808422753796097> when looking through discord I found a few times where you mentioned we might want to include both commitments. I don't quite understand that though, if the benefit from Kate commitments is that we can reduce witness sizes, wouldn't also using a merkle proof mean we don't get that benefit?

author: eth2_gitter_bot
content: <vbuterin> The idea would be that users can choose what type of witness they want

author: __lithp__
content: Maybe clients could tell their peers which kind they would prefer to receive, though since you can't reconstruct the merkle proof from the kate proof the miners would have to be generating and propagating the merkle proofs, even though they would probably use the kate proof when sending blocks to each other. Smaller blocks means their blocks have a lower chance of losing a race and being uncled.
